history.proof: split; intros H. - unfold Pell in H. shelve. - destruct H as [H1 | H2]. + subst. unfold Pell. omega. + subst. unfold Pell. omega.

exceptions.exn: [Focus] Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: 2 <= b_nat
b: Z
Hb: 2 <= b
y: Z

Goal:
Pell 0 y <-> y = 1 \/ y = -1

Premises:
Pell = fun x y : Z => x * x - b * x * y + y * y = 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Pell (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Pell_sym : forall x y : Z, Pell x y < -> Pell y x
alpha_2 : b = 2 -> forall n : nat, α n = Z.of_nat n - 1
Pos2Z.neg_xI : forall p : positive, Z.neg p~1 = 2 * Z.neg p - 1
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => match y with | 0 => Eq | Z.pos _ => Lt | Z.neg _ => Gt end | Z.pos x' => match y with | Z.pos y' => (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Gt end | Z.neg x' => match y with | Z.neg y' => CompOpp (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Lt end end : Z -> Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
Pos2Z.neg_xO : forall p : positive, Z.neg p~0 = 2 * Z.neg p
Z.lt_eq_cases : forall n m : Z, n <= m < -> n < m \/ n = m
Zsgn_spec : forall x : Z, 0 < x /\ Z.sgn x = 1 \/ 0 = x /\ Z.sgn x = 0 \/ 0 > x /\ Z.sgn x = -1
Zring = {| Radd_0_l := fun x : Z => let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := (x :: nil)%list in Zr_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEc 0) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1)) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1) I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEc 0) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1))) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1))) = true); Radd_comm := fun x...
Z.sgn_spec : forall n : Z, 0 < n /\ Z.sgn n = 1 \/ 0 = n /\ Z.sgn n = 0 \/ n < 0 /\ Z.sgn n = - (1)
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.ge = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.ge (_ _)%Z_scope
Z2Nat.inj_le : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> n <= m < -> (Z.to_nat n <= Z.to_nat m)%nat
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qnum x * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden y) < QArith_base.Qnum y * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden x) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
Z.eq_dec : forall x y : Z, {x = y} + {x <> y}
Pos.eq_dec : forall x y : positive, {x = y} + {x <> y}
Znumtheory.prime_divisors : forall p : Z, Znumtheory.prime p -> forall a : Z, (a | p) -> a = -1 \/ a = 1 \/ a = p \/ a = - p
Zle_lt_or_eq : forall n m : Z, n <= m -> n < m \/ n = m
Z.max_spec : forall n m : Z, n < m /\ Z.max n m = m \/ m <= n /\ Z.max n m = n
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
Z.divide_1_r : forall n : Z, (n | 1) -> n = 1 \/ n = - (1)
alpha_fix_1 = eq_refl : α 1 = 0
BinIntDef.Z.sgn = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos _ => 1 | Z.neg _ => -1 end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sgn _%Z_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((add_carry p q)~0)%positive | (q~0)%positive => ((add p q)~1)%positive | 1%positive => ((BinPosDef.Pos.succ p)~0)%positive end | (p~0)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((add p q)~1)%positive | (q~0)%positive => ((add p q)~0)%positive | 1%positive => (p~1)%positive end | 1%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((BinPosDef.Pos.succ q)~0)%positive | (q~0)%positive => (q~1)%positive | 1%positive => 2%positive end end with add_carry (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive...
Z2Nat.id : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> Z.of_nat (Z.to_nat n) = n
M22_opp_mult_l : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult (MI22 Ropp x) y = MI22 Ropp (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y)
Z.mul_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> 0 <= n * m
Nat2Z.inj_le : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat < -> Z.of_nat n <= Z.of_nat m
Z.opp_le_mono : forall n m : Z, n <= m < -> - m <= - n
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : Z => x + 1 : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope
Z_lt_dec : forall x y : Z, {x < y} + {~ x < y}
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, (m y < m x)%nat -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
Zr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp eq (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe2
Znumtheory.rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Znumtheory.rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
